briefing.headline: A priceless Viking longship replica is missing!
briefing.narrativeHtml: Alert all detectives: a carefully crafted Viking longship replica has gone missing from a maritime museum. Eyewitnesses report a suspect with a fascination for fjords and maritime history. Your team must follow the clues and identify the country where the trail leads.

rounds.clueHtml: A long, narrow country on a peninsula with deep coastal inlets carved by glaciers. It borders Sweden and Finland and stretches into the Arctic Circle.
rounds.explainHtml: Norway’s coastline features deep fjords formed by glaciers; it borders Sweden and Finland and extends above the Arctic Circle.

rounds.clueHtml: References to Aftenposten, lefse, and a national day celebrated on May 17 appear in the suspect’s notes.
rounds.explainHtml: These are Norwegian cultural references: Aftenposten is a major newspaper; lefse is a traditional food; Syttende Mai is Constitution Day.

rounds.clueHtml: Notes mention North Sea offshore platforms, high cost of living, and summer days when the sun barely sets.
rounds.explainHtml: North Sea petroleum, the cost of living, and the midnight sun are associated with Norway and its northern latitude.

rounds.clueHtml: Images include a stave church, a red flag with a blue cross outlined in white, and a capital located on a fjord.
rounds.explainHtml: Stave churches, the Nordic cross flag, and Oslofjord confirm Norway.

resolution.summaryHtml:
• Geography: fjords, borders SE & FI
  • Language & culture: Aftenposten, lefse, Syttende Mai
  • Economy & environment: North Sea oil, midnight sun
  • Flag & landmarks: Nordic cross, stave churches, Oslofjord
